velinov.java.vrep

Interface VrepClient

  • All Superinterfaces:
    EventDispatchable
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    StandardVrepClient

    public interface VrepClient
extends EventDispatchable
    Describes a VREP-Client which connects to a VREP-Server.
    Since:
    19.04.2015
    Author:
    Vladimir Velinov

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int DEFAULT_COMMUNICATION_CICLE
      the default communication cicle in milli-seconds.
      static java.lang.String PROPERTY_CONNECTED
      A property, that is fired when the client has connected successfully to the V-REP server.
      static java.lang.String PROPERTY_DISCONNECTED
      A property, that is fired when the client has disconnected from the V-REP server.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void close()
      closes the connection with the server.
      void connectToServer(VrepServer _server)
      connects to server.
      int getClientId() 
      boolean isConnected() 
      void waitUntilConnected(boolean _wait)
      Set if the calling thread should be suspended when calling VrepClient#connectToServer(VrepServer) until it connects.

        addPropertyChangeListener, addPropertyChangeListener, addPropertyChangeListener, removePropertyChangeListener, removePropertyChangeListener

    • Method Detail

      • getClientId

        int getClientId()
        Returns:
        the id of the client, created when connected to a particular server.

      • isConnected

        boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        true if the client is connected to the server.

      • waitUntilConnected

        void waitUntilConnected(boolean _wait)
        Set if the calling thread should be suspended when calling VrepClient#connectToServer(VrepServer) until it connects.
        Parameters:
        _wait - true if should wait.

      • connectToServer

        void connectToServer(VrepServer _server)
        connects to server.
        Parameters:
        _server - the server to connect to.

      • close

        void close()
        closes the connection with the server.
